unnormalised: Urban planning in India needs a more holistic approach. We must consider social equity, environmental sustainability, and economic viability. Consider the Dharavi redevelopment project in Mumbai - a complex case study. The IIT Kharagpur's architecture department has done some interesting research. Also, films like "Wake Up Sid" subtly showcase urban alienation, hinting at planning failures. Improving public transport (like Delhi Metro, 286 km) is critical. Integrating traditional Indian design principles, Vastu Shastra, could enhance liveability.
